ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to speak with more ease and to vary my speaking more with different grammatical structures.
I think I gathered more fluency in listening, and a better understanding of the cultural elements of central and South American societies.
I learned a lot about how to improve my Spanish skills in analysis and conversation, on topics I already knew about in English but that made it more engaging

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: it is very engaging though sometimes it is unclear how my Spanish will improve from assignments

Strengths: very conversation based, which helped develop fluency 

Weaknesses: none
The class could be a little bit more engaging or less jamboard

The class spends a lot of time on topics to the point where my engagement dropped off a little, but the topics, especially Indigenous studies are SO important and I'm glad the Spanish department is taking steps to teach about this more

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if they want to improve their spanish
Yes! It helps develop your speaking skills a lot.

I would recommend the class because it is the first time in Spanish where you do not have to spend weeks going through grammar or vocabulary, so it feels more natural and legitimate on the path to fluency.
Yes if you have to take L4, but also maybe if you don't because it was much better topic-wise than L2 and L3 that I took at Yale, although it's been a few years so they might have changed that too
